text: A concise multiplatform language developed by JetBrains Code, Learn, Repeat: Get Ready for KotlinConf 2025 KotlinConf has always been about more than just code ‚Äì it‚Äôs where ideas spark, skills develop, and the Kotlin community comes together to share knowledge, connect, and celebrate.¬† While we‚Äôre still crafting the 2025 program (stay tuned for the big reveal in February), here are the recordings of last year‚Äôs top talks to give you a taste of what to expect at the upcoming event: üé§ Why We Can‚Äôt Have Nice Things in Kotlin by Vsevolod Tolstopyatov. A delightful dive into the unexpected challenges of creating Kotlin libraries. Ever wondered how nineteenth-century insect collections impact APIs? Find out in this witty, thought-provoking session. üîç Debugging the Future: Coroutine Debugger Tools by Nikita Naza. Learn to minimize initialization time, streamline dependencies, and eliminate reflection, so you can build fast, efficient API services in Kotlin ‚Äì no compromises needed! üß† Free the World From Wasteful Scheduling With Timefold AI by Geoffrey De Smet. html:
A concise multiplatform language developed by JetBrains

Code, Learn, Repeat: Get Ready for KotlinConf 2025

KotlinConf has always been about more than just code ‚Äì it‚Äôs where ideas spark, skills develop, and the Kotlin community comes together to share knowledge, connect, and celebrate.¬†

While we‚Äôre still crafting the 2025 program (stay tuned for the big reveal in February), here are the recordings of last year‚Äôs top talks to give you a taste of what to expect at the upcoming event:

  1. üé§ Why We Can‚Äôt Have Nice Things in Kotlin by Vsevolod Tolstopyatov. A delightful dive into the unexpected challenges of creating Kotlin libraries. Ever wondered how nineteenth-century insect collections impact APIs? Find out in this witty, thought-provoking session.
  1. üîç Debugging the Future: Coroutine Debugger Tools by Nikita Naza. Master coroutine debugging with deep insights and powerful tools.
  1. ‚òÅÔ∏è Have Your Serverless Kotlin Functions and Eat Them Too by Andrew O‚ÄôHara. Learn to minimize initialization time, streamline dependencies, and eliminate reflection, so you can build fast, efficient API services in Kotlin ‚Äì no compromises needed!
  1. üß† Free the World From Wasteful Scheduling With Timefold AI by Geoffrey De Smet. Learn how to tackle complex planning problems like scheduling and routing efficiently using Timefold, an Apache-licensed AI solver for Kotlin. Live coding guaranteed!
  1. üé® Tap it! Shake it! Fling it! Sheep it! by Nicole Terc. Combining gesture animations with Compose Multiplatform, this presentation is fun, interactive, and packed with tips for Android and iOS.
  1. üöÄ Evolving Compose Multiplatform on iOS and Beyond by Sebastian Aigner. A sneak peek into the future of Compose Multiplatform with new features like common previews, lifecycle, and navigation.
  1. üåü The Best Programmer I Know by Daniel Terhorst-North. A heartfelt exploration of what truly makes a great programmer, this one is inspiring and relatable.

This year, expect an equally dynamic mix of technical deep dives, practical sessions, and soft skill talks tailored for every Kotlin enthusiast across backend, mobile, web, and desktop. But KotlinConf isn‚Äôt just about the talks! The event also provides the opportunity to network with thousands of professional developers, build new connections through various activities, flex your coding skills in fun challenges, and recharge your passion for development during unforgettable social events, including an epic after-party!

Don‚Äôt miss out on the energy and inspiration that is KotlinConf. Let‚Äôs learn, build, and celebrate together. üéüÔ∏è Secure your spot today!
